description.narrative: The main objective of this project is to provide life-saving agricultural livelihoods assistance to internally displaced persons, returnees and host community members in Ituri and North Kivu. This FAO project provides agricultural kits including seeds to 5,500 farmer households, and distributes $600,000 in multi-purpose cash transfers to 5,000 farmer households. The project provides life-saving assistance to 63,000 people, including 22,680 women, 15,120 men, 25,200 children, and 3,300 persons with disabilities.
